alert.note: Alert for Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 4:03PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Orange County through 445 PM EDT... At 403 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chapel Hill, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chapel Hill, Hillsborough, Carrboro and Eno River State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
